summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 regarding a letter from MDC Brooklyn legal counsel in response to a court order in the case US v. Maxwell. The correspondence involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney, MDC legal counsel, and Judge Nathan's chambers discussing the filing of the letter on the public docket.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge Nathan issued a memorandum endorsement on April 27, 2021, in the case US v. Maxwell, and her chambers are involved in the correspondence regarding its filing.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: He is the Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who sent the email on April 28, 2021, attaching a letter from MDC legal counsel and stating the government has no objection to its public docketing.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: She is copied on the email chain regarding the memorandum endorsement in US v. Maxwell, indicating her involvement in the legal proceedings.

connections.description: Pagliuca, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is corresponding with Judge Nathan's chambers regarding court orders and filings in the US v. Maxwell case.
Menninger is copied on correspondence related to Judge Nathan's court order in the Maxwell case, indicating her role in the legal proceedings before the judge.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Nathan signed a memorandum endorsement in the case US v. Maxwell, which was to be filed on the public docket.

events.title: MDC Legal Counsel Response
events.description: MDC Brooklyn legal counsel provided a letter in response to Judge Nathan's April 27, 2021, court order, which the government had no objection to docketing publicly.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from April 2021 related to the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20-cr-330).
Judge Nathan issued a court order on April 27, 2021, requiring a response from MDC Brooklyn legal counsel.
Assistant U.S. Attorney Jeff Pagliuca facilitated the communication and stated the government had no objection to making the MDC's response letter public.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination between the court, prosecution, and detention facility legal staff regarding case filings.
